claims: Canadians work fewer hours per week than Mexicans

state.response: کینیڈین فی ہفتہ میکسیکن سے کم گھنٹے کام کرتے ہیں۔
claims: Canadians work fewer hours per week than Mexicans

Canadians work fewer hours per week than: Average weekly work hours in Canada Average weekly work hours in Mexico

The average hours of male workers also decreased from 1997 to 2022, declining from 40.2 to 38.1. Among women, average weekly work hours fell slightly from 33.7 in 1976 to 32.7 in 1996, before rising by 0.7 to 33.2 from 1997 to 2022.
Average weekly work hours in Canada Average weekly work hours in Mexico

FAQ. What are the standard working hours for employees in Mexico? According to Mexican labor laws, employees' standard working hours range from 40 to 48 hours per week. How are overtime hours and compensation handled in Mexico?

detail.reasoning: The text claims that Canadians work fewer hours per week than Mexicans. The evidence provided indicates that the average weekly work hours for Canadians have decreased over time, with men working 38.1 hours and women working 33.2 hours as of 2022. In contrast, Mexican labor laws state that standard working hours range from 40 to 48 hours per week. This suggests that Mexicans generally work more hours per week than Canadians, supporting the claim in the text.
